SigScheme is a [http://www.schemers.org/Documents/Standards/R5RS/ R5RS] [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scheme_%28programming_language%29 Scheme] interpreter for embedded use.

It features small footprint (64KB in library form on the 'small' configuration) like [http://www.cs.indiana.edu/scheme-repository/imp/siod.html SIOD] and [http://tinyscheme.sourceforge.net/ TinyScheme], low memory consumption (2-words per cons cell), multibyte characters handling (UTF-8, EUCs and Shift_JIS) and more.

It is mainly developed to replace the Scheme interpreter of [http://code.google.com/p/uim/ uim].
